text:
Q: dialogflow and google sheets API A:

Yes, there is a sample available on Dialogflow's Github page here for some guidance on getting started. According to the Google Sheets API reference documentation and depending on your circumstances, you'll either need to use .append or .update for write operations. A crucial step will be sharing the specific sheet with the service account client email address provided to you in the private key json file.

Q: Playwright: page content jumps alternating from left to right and back A:

What you're seeing is almost always layout shifting caused by dynamic UI changes.

During the verification step the page toggles CSS (scrollbars, overflow, or animations) which makes the DOM move and elements detach or become non interactable.

Start by stabilizing the viewport and scrollbar

await page.set_viewport_size({"width": 1280, "height": 900})
await page.add_style_tag(content="html {overflow-y:scroll !important;}")

Q: When big data : requests.exceptions.ConnectionError: ('Connection aborted.', RemoteDisconnected('Remote end closed connection without response')) A:

The error is not caused by pandas.

Google Sheets API is closing the connection when the update payload gets too large.

With a small DataFrame the update works, but once you add more columns ws.update(payload) sends a much bigger JSON body in a single request. At that point the server drops the connection and requests shows it as:

RemoteDisconnected('Remote end closed connection without response')

so your request to Google sheets API is sending all values in one HTTP request which is hitting limits on request body size or execution time.

Fix: Send the data in smaller chunks instead of one huge update call.

Q: Read from a hive table and write back to it using spark sql A:

The solution I found for this problem is to read directly from hdfs and persist & force evaluation using .count() method before the overwrite

Q: How to turn off SSL from the Windows client library mariadb connector-c 3.4.8 win64 A:

Beside the previous answer, you can also set environment variable MARIADB_TLS_DISABLE_PEER_VERIFICATION:

set MARIADB_TLS_DISABLE_PEER_VERIFICATION=1

If you prefer to change the c code, you need to set only MYSQL_OPT_SSL_VERIFY_SERVER_CERT to off (but use one byte variable, not 4 byte int):

uint8_t verify = 0;
rc= mysql_options(mysql, MYSQL_OPT_SSL_VERIFY_SERVER_CERT, &verify);
